title: minor typo in "Slices" documentation in "Effective Go"
body:
by **shawn.milo**: 
I'm pretty sure the "Slices" section has a typo here:

    To read into the first 32 bytes of a larger buffer b, slice (here used as a verb) the buffer.

The code sample is: 

    n, err := f.Read(buf[0:32])

So I'm pretty sure that "buffer b" was meant to be "buffer buf," or
maybe "buf" was meant to be "b."

http://golang.org/doc/effective_go.html#slices
